WorkItem.Description:
As discussed here https://mui.codeplex.com/discussions/444036

Vote if you are ok for:

 * kozw to replace the Microsoft.Windows.Shell dependency dll that is bound to .NET Framework 2.0 by the source of Microsoft.Windows.Shell

Pros : 

* You no more link to .NET 2.0
* You don't force a Windows 8 user to activate .NET 2.0 just for this dll
* Direct access to Microsoft.Windows.Shell sources from your project

Cons :

* Your binary will be approximatively 150KB bigger
* May have Licensing issues as it requires to decompile the MS dll, well that's an old one anyway, to note that the WPF Shell project does it too with an older version of the same dll

Comments.Message: Please note, there is a related issue: https://mui.codeplex.com/workitem/19695

This has been resolved in changeset 101034 by dropping the dependency in the .NET4.5 version of mui. Support for custom window chromes is built-in in System.Windows.Shell namespace of .NET4.5.

Please note that the dependency is still required for .NET4 projects.
